meanings.definition: A type of continuous paper folded like a fan for use in printers.
meanings.sent1: The printer ran out of fanfold paper, so we had to switch to regular sheets.
meanings.sent2: The fanfold paper neatly stacked in the printer, ready for the next batch of documents.
meanings.sent3: When the fanfold paper got stuck, it looked like a colorful accordion playing a tune.
meanings.sent4: The fanfold paper unfolded smoothly, revealing a rainbow of printed information.
meanings.sent5: The fanfold paper rustled softly as it fed through the printer, creating a rhythmic sound.

meanings.definition: To fold (paper) in a fanfold pattern for use in printers.
meanings.sent1: She carefully fanfolded the paper before loading it into the printer.
meanings.sent2: Remember to fanfold the paper to ensure it feeds correctly through the printer.
meanings.sent3: He fanfolded the paper with such precision that it resembled an origami masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The way she fanfolded the paper was like watching a skilled craftsman at work.
meanings.sent5: As she fanfolded the paper, each crease created a satisfying pattern.
